column2: The Roman Empire has been restored and you are its Emperor.  When you think about the great cultural achievements of the Romans, their traditions and their institutions, you can't help but feel somehow connected to them.  After all, if the Roman Emperor isn't Roman, is there really a Roman Empire?

column2: As you walk through the gardens your mind wanders.  Your gaze falls upon a statue of some conqueror from days past.  ''He probably thought he'd become the next Alexander.''  That's when it came to you.  What separates most men from Alexander? From Caesar?  From Hannibal?  Only the will to vanquish, only the audacity to call yourself conqueror...

column2: Although you once had the drive and the will to conquer the world, a series of setbacks and personal failures has sapped your will, and you no longer have the gall to call yourself a conqueror.

column2: Although our Lord and Saviour preached compassion and forgiveness, many of our other deities demand a different sort of devotion.  Non-Jesusites will have to pay us a duty.

column2: Your wise liege, [From.GetTitledFirstName], has summoned you and [From.GetHerHis] other vassals to a blot. There you will worship and give sacrifice to the lesser deities before taking part in a great feast where you drink to their name.
column3: Your wise liege, [From.GetTitledFirstName], has summoned you and [From.GetHerHis] other vassals to a blot. There you will worship and give sacrifice to the lesser deities before taking part in a great feast where you drink to their name.

column2: Your liege, [From.GetTitledFirstName], remains trapped in [From.GetHerHis] savage ways, and now [From.GetSheHe] has summoned all of [From.GetHerHis] vassals to a blot where [From.GetSheHe] intends to give sacrifice to [From.GetHerHis] pagan gods. Since you do not practise their absurd religion, you will be expected to contribute gold in order to be exempted from this ceremony.

column2: Despite having sworn you fealty, [From.GetTitledFirstName] refuses to offer gold in order to be exempted from the blot! According to [From.GetFirstName], [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName] would not forgive [From.GetHerHim] if [From.GetSheHe] contributed as much as a single copper to our holy festival.

column2: The guests have arrived, and the time has come for the blot to begin! You gather outside the church, and start by offering animals as sacrifice to the lesser deities. While their meat is prepared for the feast that is to follow, orators dazzle the crowd with sermons of Christ’s supremacy and love of man

column2: Although you have been told little, the noise from outside your dungeon is enough to make it clear that your captor, [Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] is holding a blot where [Root.Host.GetSheHe] will offer sacrifice in the name of [Root.Host.GetHerHis] religion. Guards burst inside your cell and drag you away to the smoldering pit outside the local church...

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] is brought up from your dungeons and escorted to the sacrificial fires. Someone binds [From.GetHerHis] hands and feet. He looks at you with pleading eyes. Don't do this, [Root.GetFirstName]. There has to be some other way...

column2: Your sister, [From.GetTitledFirstName], is dragged up from her dungeon and escorted to the temple. She looks up at you with tears streaming down her face as your guards bind [From.GetHerHis] hands and feet. Please, [Root.GetFirstName], she says with a trembling voice. Don't let them do this.

column2: The guards drag your father, [From.GetTitledFirstName], from his dungeon and escort him to the sacrificial fires where they bind him. My [Root.GetSonDaughter], he croaks while looking at you. Can't you find it in your heart to forgive me?

column2: Distant screaming can be heard as your guards drag your mother, [From.GetTitledFirstName], from her dungeon. They bring her to the sacrificial fires and as they bind her, she looks at you with pleading eyes. W-why would you do this to your own mother?

column2: The guards fetch your son, [From.GetTitledFirstName], from his dungeon and lead him to the sacrificial fires. Someone binds [From.GetHerHis] hands and feet and lead him onto the platform. Before your shove him into the coals, your son looks at you with tearful eyes. Please don't, [Root.GetFatherMother]... please don't.

column2: Your daughter, [From.GetTitledFirstName], is pulled from her dungeon and brought to the sacrificial fires by your guards. To do this... against your own daughter?

column2: Your spouse, [From.GetTitledFirstName], is dragged to the gallows in front of the sacrificial fires and your guards bind [From.GetHerHis] hands and feet. In a last desperate effort to save  [From.GetHerselfHimself], [From.GetFirstName] calls out to you for mercy. I have always loved you, [Root.GetFirstName]... and I always will.

column2: Your liege's guards have brought a Christian, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], to the sacrificial fires. As the ropes are placed around [FromFrom.GetHerHis] hands, [FromFrom.GetSheHe] continues to prattle on about the Holy Spirit and how we shall all suffer in Hell for our sins... but soon [FromFrom.GetSheHe] speaks no more.

column2: It seems your liege has decided to sacrifice [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], [From.GetHerHis] own sister, to the Lord's servants. She has been brought out from [From.GetFirstName]'s dungeons.  As they bind her hands and feet she pleads for her life.  She is thrown into the pit below, maybe she'll get her wish. Maybe she'll wish she hadn't.

column2: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], the mother of your liege, appears before the sacrificial fires flanked by guards, and to your surprise they escort her right up to the platform for the condemned. She pleads in vain with [From.GetTitledFirstName], but [From.GetSheHe] will not be moved. Within moments, she her body is committed to the flames below.

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] marches [From.GetTitledHerHis] own son, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], to the sacrificial fires outside the church. He is to be the next sacrifice. All of his pleas fall on deaf ears, and moments later the guards place throw him into the fire pit.  We'll see how much of him survives.

column2: In honor of this blot, your liege produces an Aztec from deep within [From.GetHerHis] dungeons. [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] is brought to the temple for the sacrifice, and everyone agrees that this is a most worthy sacrifice.

column2: As you have no prisoners languishing in your dungeons that are suitable for sacrifice at the blot, you are forced to make do with some randomly purchased slaves. They are brought to the sacrificial fires outside the church, and soon their charred and unrecognisable bodies are being fished from the smouldering pit.

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] is brought up from your dungeons and escorted to the sacrificial fires. When [From.GetSheHe] sees the bindings about to be locked around [From.GetHerHis] limbs, [From.GetSheHe] pushes the nearest guard aside and makes a desperate run for it, but to no avail. Your men drag [From.GetHerHim] kicking and screaming back to the flames.

column2: One day while riding through [Root.GetName], you and yours come across nearby hidden voices - some sort of gathering is happening in the wild.  Your bodyguard warn it might be a den of thieves or a coven of witches, but you aren’t as sure.

column2: You come upon a group of what appear to be Catholics in the wilderness worshipping our gods in our garb.  You ask one of the men leading the service what's happening here, and he informs you that they are worshipping Jesus Christ and all the deities who serve him.  They call themselves Jesusites.

column2: Tell me more of your most interesting faith...

column2: I will leave you to it then.

column2: Create the Pope of the Jesusite faith and give our religion a formal religious head

Hold a great blot in the name of Jesus Christ and the deities who serve him together with your vassals and offer sacrifice to the gods for good harvests and success on the battlefield.  Human sacrifices are thrown into a great smouldering pit and are burned alive or survive the ordeal according to the will of The Holy Ghost.  This can only be done every ninth year.

column2:
Jesusites believe that Jesus Christ is the one (Trinitarian) God, but that several lesser god-like deities exist. These lesser deities rule over primitive animistic domains as fiefs to Christ's Kingship. Defining features in-game:
§Y*§! The Pope of Jesus can be created
§Y*§! The Pope of Jesus can grant divorces
§Y*§! The Pope of Jesus can Excommunicate Jesusite characters
§Y*§! Jesusite lords can hold their version of the Blot

column2: The reformed generic Pagan faith has a Holy Book with lists of gods and minor deities, formal rules for sacrifice and suggested methods of divination. The church has a standardized liturgy and a formal church hierarchy. Defining features in-game:\n§Y*§! Can raid neighbours for loot\n§Y*§! Vassals don't care how long their liege raises their levies
